Product Build#: Eclipse I20070323 + DTP 20070329 + BIRT 20070321 + EMF + GEF
Platform/Version : Windows2000Pro/WindowsXP/Windows 2003/Vista/RHEL 5
Language: EN/TC/SC/TU/KO

===== DEFECT DESCRIPTION =====
1. When try to create new data source from Data Explorer view, I'm able to select connection profile file (<EclipseWorkspace>\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity\ServerProfiles.dat), however, the wizard cannot discover any data source defined within.

2. If I uncheck "Use the default data source name" and type in a name and click "Finish" bottom, an error will appear.

         An unexpected internal exception occurred ,Please see log for detail    
         clickdetail button show  :
           
          An unexpected internal exception occurred.Please see log for detail.
          Plug-in Provider:Eclipse.org
          Plug-in Name:BIRT Designer UI
          Plug-in ID:org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui
          Version:2.2.0.v20070321
          Error Code:Error.GUIException.invokedByUnexpectedException
          Error Message:Caused by org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.OdaException.
                        

===== STEPS TO RECREATE =====
Step 1:  Start Eclipse and if the current perspective is not the Report Designer.
, set the perspective to Report Designer from Window->Open Perspective->Other? 

Step 2:  Create a blank report from File->New->New Report
Step 3: Select the project name and click Finish on the New Report dialog.
Step 4: Create a new data source by opening Data Explorer, right click Data Source, and select New Data Source.
Step 5: Select ?Create from a connection profile in the profile store? on New Data Source dialog and click Next.
Step 6: On Select a Connection Profile dialog, set the profile(ServerProfiles.dat) from <EclipseWorkspace>\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity folder.
Click Next and click Finish.

The other error is actually in the BIRT Designer, not DTP.  Which version of JDK or JRE are you using with BIRT?  The version of BIRT 20070321 used in testing is not a stable version.  In fact, BIRT Designer is having a major change in this area in M6, due to release on April 6.  

Re-assigning this bug to the Connectivity Mgt framework to look into the problem with loading the CP file.  
In the meantime, I will try out the second problem with the latest version of BIRT Designer, and will create a separate bug if the problem still exists.

Finish button not enable

The dialog could read the connection profile now, however, the finish button doesn't enable. I need to click "Back" to go back to the previous dialog and try again.

Hey Linda,

You might want to take a look at this.  I'm not sure if it's a defect or a known issue or not.

Rob

This problem didn't exist in M6.  Apparently, the o.e.d.connectivity.ui base class NewConnectionProfileWizardPage has added some checking in RC0, which now sets its page as incomplete for this use case, and thus the Finish button is not enabled.

This page is actually hidden when used by the ODA new data source wizard. 
The ODA design framework now sets the page as skippable, which allows the Finish button to be enabled.
